_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OUR COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  THE PRESIDENT AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  THIS COMANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SPECIALIZES IN THE SALE OF FERTILIZER AND AG CHEMICALS TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS.

OUR PLANT CONSIST OF TWO TANKS--ONE 30,000 AND ONE 26,000 GALLON, WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 246,000 POUNDS WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO HAS THE POTENTIALTO RELEASE 132,000 POUNDS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.1 MILES AND COULD EFFECT APPROXIMATELY 10,000 AREA RESIDENTS.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE HAS A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .41 MILES AND  HAS THE POTENTIAL TO EFFECT APPROXIMATEY 3,000 RESIDENTS.  THERE ARE SEVERAL PUBLIC RECEPTORS FOR  BOTH SCENARIO'S WITHIN THIS AREA.

THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH3 PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.  OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, PROPER PLANT OPERATION, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND  EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS.

WITH THE ABOVE MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY SIMPLE TO REPORT TO THE EPA, THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC AND TO THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE COUNTY LEPC.  THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
